abstract: JPMorgan Chase reported a 23 percent drop in its quarterly earnings, but one significant bright spot for the bank was its growth in corporate loans.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase reported a 23 percent drop in its quarterly earnings, but one significant bright spot for the bank was its growth in corporate loans.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street, more than three years after the financial crisis, has loosened its lending tap. Consumers, however, have yet to reap the benefits.

headline.main: Lending Helps JPMorgan, but 4th Quarter Was Soft

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Peter Eavis
